head.supplied: Town Hall Melbourne ¶ 4th August 1871 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ In reply to your letter of the 17th ultimo ¶ asking to have two laborers placed under your control for the purpose of planting willows &c on the bank...

div.p: Unit 18, p. 188, VPRS 4025/P Town Clerk's letter press copy books, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
In reply to your letter of the 17th ultimo
M to T. M'Pherson, 17 July 1871. asking to have two laborers placed under your control for the purpose of planting willows &c on the banks of the Yarra, I am desired by the Health Committee of the Council of the City of Melbourne to inform you that at present the Corporation have no laborers employed in the parks, and consequently are unable to comply with your request.
See also M to E. FitzGibbon, 10 August 1871.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be
